results.title: Rhythm
results.brief_description:
Originally planned as a work for Chrysler Corporation’s weekly television program, ‘Rhythm’ presents a montage of the factory workers, machinery and materials on a car production assembly line.
Lye has edited his footage with a staccato feel that he has matched with the percussive music used for the soundtrack.
Although rejected by Chrysler, the film won first prize in the television category in the 1957 New York Art Directors’ Festival but was subsequently disqualified because it had never been broadcast.

results.title: Rabbit control. Part 2: follow up
results.creator_credit: Ian Blythman, John Atkins and Dept of Conservation, Forests and Land
results.brief_description: Part 2 of a programme designed to control the rabbit population and their adverse effects on farming. This episode, which is narrated by Maurie Fields, looks at fumigation, destruction of habitat, baiting and shooting with follow-up procedures to ensure successful control of rabbit populations.

results.title: Senior Campus
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: In panel interviews, staff, students and parents of two schools, Bendigo Senior High and Kurani College, Morwell, discuss issues related to planning, developing and running of a senior campus and a school complex with a senior campus.

results.title: At sea
results.brief_description: A baby boy dies on the journey from Los Angeles to Australia and is buried at sea. Many years later his mother still grieves for him, painfully and bitterly. Penny Fowler Smith uses highly evocative and sometimes abstract imagery to visual the mother’s emotional narration. At Sea is a cinematic reflection on loss.

results.title: Just desserts
results.brief_description: This wonderfully sensuous short presents the rites of puberty as a menu of Italian favourites: a young girls first period occurs when she is stomping the grapes; gnocchi is forever to remind her of first having sex with a boy; burnt polenta is the taste of lesbian longing. A lovely remembrance of an Italo-Australian adolescence.

results.title: Preserving native grasslands
results.creator_credit: Conservation Forrest and Lands and Victoria. Dept of Conservation, Forests and Lands
results.brief_description: This program examines the problem of our disappearing native grasslands due to the urban sprawl, introduced species and weeds. The department of Conservation, Forests and Land have put out a booklet promoting public awareness of native plants (grasses, flowers and herbs), when and how to identify them, and the various steps involved in preserving them. No other credits available.

results.title: Rachel; Just one of the kids
results.creator_credit: Tony Paice and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: 1. “Rachel” (40 min.) is the story of a young girl with a disability making her transition from a small rural community school to a large country technical school. 2. “Just one of the kids” (20 min.) shows the development of integration in the state school system.
